intro: Hieracium warmingii var. lechleri, commonly known as the Amazonian buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the tropical rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understorey of dense forests. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, oval-shaped seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to its unique habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
